text.p: Lithuania's Snoras Bank said on Monday that it expected its profit for the first half of 1997 to reach around four million litas to eight million litas.
"It will be about four million to seven or eight million litas," Aleksandr Chernov, Snoras Bank vice-chairman, told Reuters.
"I'm one hundred percent sure it will be somewhere in there," he added.
Chernov said last year's first-half profit was between two and three million litas and expected the result for the first six months of 1997 at the end of this week.
Snoras Bank showed a first quarter profit of 3.82 million litas and an audited 1996 net profit of 11.27 million litas.
Deposits in Snoras passed the 300 million litas mark for the first time in the bank's history in June, Snoras said earlier this month.
Deposits at the end of June stood at 308 million litas.
